sub_title: saxophonist, composer, bandleader, manager at Eyeman All Stars at EyemanMusic
summary:
Saxophonist Iman Spaargaren is a full time professional jazz musician, composer, arranger and teacher. Iman works for EyemanMusic as a manager of Undercurrent Trio, Eyeman All Stars, Pelican Three, Spaargaren, De Wit, Luther, StarkLinnemann Quartet. He is promotor, agent, initiator and bandcoach.

Specialties: saxophone, clarinet, bass clarinet, composition, arrangements, bandleader, soloist, music producer, manager.

www.imanspaargaren.nl

projects.title: Iman Spaargaren Undercurrent
projects.description:
The newly formed group Iman Spaargaren Undercurrent has released their debut CD In The Moment June 2013. Piano player Franz von Chossy (DE, Franz von Chossy Quintet), guitarist Guillermo Celano (AR, Celano/Baggiani Group), drummer Jasper van Hulten (NL, Wouter Hamel, Erik Vloeimans), double bass player Cord Heineking (DE, Simin Tander) and trumpet player Dirk Beets (NL, ex-Monsieur Dubois) joined their forces.
In The Moment offers exciting, free-spirited and intense music.

In 2013 the group played o.a. at Jazzahead 2013, North Sea Jazzclub (Amsterdam), Jazzahead (Bremen), etc.

Press about 'In The Moment' (CD and CD Release concert):
"Melody and lyricism are strong features of saxophonist and composer Iman Spaargaren. With clear expositions he wanders on paths leading to adventure without ever getting lost. Melodic sounds on tenor- and soprano saxophone, played by the bandleader with great empathy, are commentated by guitarist Guillermo Celano with his rough sound. Great to see that the different characters of the bandmembers [Celano, Heineking, Baggiani and Spaargaren] fit together so well. Spaargaren put a great band together for sure" (Jan Jasper Tamboer, het Parool, 2013).

"Iman Spaargaren: a busy man, not deprived of outstanding musical qualities, as an instrumentalist as well as a composer. On his newest album all 11 compositions are his writing. The pieces have an almost natural simplicity and sound transparant and spacious due to the line up and the high quality of Spaargaren's bandmembers - guitarist Guillermo Celano, bassist Cord Heineking and drummer Jasper van Hulten. It is nice listenable modern harmonic jazz, which has solos  of great stature by the tenorsaxophonist - sometimes on bass clarinet - Spaargaren and guitarist Celano" (Jacques Los, Draaiomjeoren, 2013).

contributors.headline: saxophonist, composer, bandleader, manager at Eyeman All Stars at EyemanMusic

projects.title: European Union Quartet + 1
projects.description:
European Union Quartet has invited the amazing pianist Dan Whieldon to join the group for a series of concerts.

"intense interplay and freedom to express individual ideas" (Jazzenzo.nl)

“EU4: a great young band with a warm, acoustic sound, a sensitive dynamic awareness and an engaging repertoire of fresh, tuneful, contemporary compositions. The band members have gigged-in their ensemble playing well and it shows: their performance has a relaxed and confident air, yet sounds fresh every time and is 	destined to reach out to audiences far beyond their continent” (Steve Mead, Artistic 	Director, Manchester Jazz Festival, UK)

“The melodies played by saxophone and guitar in unison create a dreamy and romantic atmosphere, which is worked out in tasteful improvisations of both soloists and is accompanied by a strong rhythm section” (Muziekwereld Review).

“Elbracht is lovely and limpid; Spaargaren is pure-toned and keeps his power in check. In all, a finely judged mix of freedom and restraint” (City Life Album Review).

From 2008 on, the group has been playing extensively in the UK, Scotland, Ireland, Belgium and the Netherlands. They played at the Manchester International Jazz Festival, The Lescar (Sheffield), The Jazz Bar (Edinburgh), Limerick Jazz Society (Ireland), Sounds Jazzclub (Brussel), Hopper Jazzclub (Antwerpen), Schouwburg Almere, Jazz in Zevenbergen, Jazz Affairs (Hoorn) and Muziekbibliotheek Utrecht,.
The European Union Quartet released their second album 'The Dark Peak' in october 2011 on the independent  O.A.P. label of Barry Olthof (The Hague, Netherlands). Since their debut album the band has been working hard in creating a very distinctive sound of their own.

Line up: Iman Spaargaren (NL) – tenor and soprano saxophone, bass-clarinet / Ulrich Elbracht (D) – guitar / Gavin Barras (UK) – double bass / Marek Dorcik (SK) – drums / Dan Whieldon (UK) - piano

contributors.headline: saxophonist, composer, bandleader, manager at Eyeman All Stars at EyemanMusic

projects.title: Thelonious4
projects.description:
Thelonious4 (www.thelonious4.com), like the name suggests, plays compositions of Thelonious Monk in a very distinctive style and with an interesting international personnel: saxophones/clarinets (Iman Spaargaren/NL), guitar/effects (Guillermo Celano/Argentina), double bass (Andreas Metzler/D) and drums (Jurjen Bakker/NL).
In 2011 Thelonious4 has released the 2nd cd: 'Live at the Hot House'. The recordings were done during a magnificent concert at Hot House in Leiden, Holland.
The energy and musical adventure leave you in astonishment! Monk's compositions are being torn apart, closely examined, and put together in a different fashion again. True swing, soundscapes, burning improvisations and witty interplay.

At the moment Thelonious4 is working on the release of the next album with guest soloist Tony Miceli (vibraphone) from Philadelphia, USA. Release will be at the end of 2012.

Coming from different musical backgrounds the band members always reach for the highest level of expression. This working ensemble approaches the traditional quartet format from a new perspective, creating a unique ensemble sound. The blend of tenor saxophone and electric jazzguitar is a beguiling one, and this Amsterdam based jazzquartet exploits it with great skill. The neat band is complemented by steady and highly creative double bass and drums.

With the release of their first album 'Thelonious 4' one can already here a shared vision of swing, taste and execution. This foursome reflects the true heart of Monk's music, ballads and sly blues or vigorous groove music.

Thelonious 4 played on different festivals such as Te Gast in Garnwerd, East of Eastern, Huse Jazzt and in various jazzclubs in Europe.
The individual members of the group played on festivals such as North Sea Jazzfestival and at jazzclubs such as BIMhuis, De Tor, Paradox, SJU Jazzpodium, etc.

contributors.headline: saxophonist, composer, bandleader, manager at Eyeman All Stars at EyemanMusic

projects.title: Iman Spaargaren Quartet: Young VIP Tour 2012
projects.description:
“Spaargaren is skilful at blowing long lyrical lines. The sound of the Quartet is attractive and the compositions are very varied” (de Volkskrant, BIMhuis concert review 1 march 2012).

“The music sounds thoughtful, cautious, in a moderate tempo. Spaargaren has a strong voice of his own. Quality and talent are undeniable, his melodic and harmonic caracteristics are strong, a true choice as Young VIP” (Jazzenzo, BIMhuis concert review 1 march 2012).

"Flow is filled with enthousiastic, hard-driven, contemporary jazz. The compositions by Iman vary from very expressive to dreamy, from light-footed to funky" (SJU Jazzpodium, Utrecht).

"A promising modern jazz album. Iman's compositions stand for very melodical, light-footed musical lines. Spaargaren solos with great skill: modest and beautifully frased; he lets his emotions run free" (draaiomjeoren.nl).

"Contemporary adventure. Iman Spaargaren Quartet and Septet play eager and energetic, but remain within a melodical spectrum" (JB, Nederlands Dagblad).

"Iman is an important player in the Dutch jazzscene" (Jazzflits).

The best musicians on the Dutch jazz scene turn Flow into an album jam-packed with energetic, enthousiastic, modern jazz. The atmosphere of Iman's original compositions and arrangements ranges from excited to dreamy, from light-footed to funky. 

Iman's saxophone playing catches the ear with his very personal and lyrical tone and inventive use of rhythm. His arrangements for septet make one think of the works of Amina Figarova en Wayne Shorter.

Line up: Iman Spaargaren – tenor-, sopranosax and bass-clarinet / Gerard Kleijn – trumpet / Mark Lotz – flute / Marike van Dijk – altosax / Marzio Scholten and Santeri Sulkunen – guitar / Cord Heineking – double bass / Mark Coehoorn and Klaas van Donkersgoed – drums

profile_positions.description:
EyeMan All Stars featuring:
Iman Spaargaren - tenor saxophone
Dirk Balthaus - fender rhodes & piano
Hendrik Müller - double bass
Efraim Schulz-Wackerbarth - drums & percussion

New album 'Sly Fly' is out!

A fresh group based in Amsterdam who combines hip jazz improvisation with stone grooves.
Songs ranging from Eddie Harris-70’s funk (Get A Life) to New Orleans-style grooves (Snaakje), from Afro-groove (Monsieur Toubab) to Motown vibes (Sly Fly). And from lush soundscape (Dreamstate) to Brazilian samba (New Morning).
Check their debut album 'Sly Fly' which will be released in January 2021 on Eyeman Records! 
Strong melodies go together with colorful chords while a groovy bass and tight drums glue it all together. Passionate solo’s and positive vibes make this new album a true musical trip.

You can listen to the album here: https://imanspaargaren.bandcamp.com/album/sly-fly
profile_positions.title: saxophonist, composer, bandleader, manager at Eyeman All Stars

profile_positions.description:
The exciting international group Undercurrent Trio plays thrilling, free and intense music. Saxophonist, (bass) clarinet player Iman Spaargaren (NL), guitarist Guillermo Celano (ARG) and drummer Marcos Baggiani (ARG) join forces.

Undercurrent Trio
The music of Undercurrent Trio offers a wide variety of different moods. Melodies from the heart tell a story while the band moves through musical landscapes using different timbre and contrasts. Adventures in musical styles create cinematic music in dreamy colours, dark gloomy thick grooves or sharp edgy political commentary.
The three musicians explore the engaging and sometimes compelling compositions by taking much freedom of expression and by creating strong interplay and fierce improvisations by all three members.
The unusual instrumentation of clarinet, bass clarinet, tenor saxophone, guitar and drums offers the listener a fresh sound. The use of musical space is a strongpoint of the Trio. 
Their debut-CD In The Moment features the group in a larger setting with double bass, trumpet and piano.
In 2019 the new fresh album High Tide Low Tide will be released on Flea Boy Records!

Guillermo has worked with o.a. Michael Moore, Joachim Badenhorst, Clemens van der Feen, Ellery Eskelin, Chris Cheek, Ingrid Laubrock, Gerard Kleijn, Joost Kesselaar, Robin Verheyen, Josef Dumoulin and Gorka Benitez.
Marcos Baggiani is a versatile drummer with firm roots in improvised music. Over the years he has been working with o.a. Sylvie Courvoisier, David Kweksilber, John Edwards, Ernst Reijseger, Han Bennink, Achim Kaufmann.

Line up Undercurrent Trio:
Iman Spaargaren - tenor saxophone, clarinet, bass clarinet
Guillermo Celano - guitar, effects
Marcos Baggiani - drums, percussion
profile_positions.title: Bandleader, saxophonist, (bass) clarinet player, composer, arranger, manager, promotor

profile_positions.description: The Iman Spaargaren Quartet & Septet has released the debut album 'Flow' in 2011. All compositions are written and arranged by Iman. Iman Spaargaren Quartet has done the Young VIP Tour in 2012.
profile_positions.title: saxophonist, composer, arranger

profile_positions.description:
Independent promotor at EyemanMusic.
EyemanMusic is a young company actively involved in booking, promoting and managing Iman Spaargaren Quartet, Iman Spaargaren Septet, European Union Quartet and Quintet, Thelonious4, Captain Hook, Dijkman&Spaargaren and other groups.

profile_positions.title: saxophonist

profile_positions.description:
Pelican Three deliberately wallows in idiosyncratic compositions by using a wide range of sounds and textures. From lyrical chamber music to raw punk and from sensitive free compositions to humorous escapades with respect for and knowledge of the jazz tradition.
Intense interplay of the three team players creates crystal clear storylines and passionate solos in an unusual line-up.
Dirk Beets - trumpet, flugel horn
Iman Spaargaren - tenor saxophone, bass clarinet
Mark Tuinstra - guitar
profile_positions.title: saxophonist, clarinettist, composer

company.name: Vereniging van Docenten van de Stichting Het Muziekpakhuis

profile_positions.company: Vereniging van Docenten van de Stichting Het Muziekpakhuis
profile_positions.title: Saxophone teacher

profile_positions.description:
DJAM is a private school offering training in Jazz and Contemporary Music was founded in 1990. The school's concept was developed by Christian Hassenstein and other instructors from various Dutch conservatories. With this concept, DJAM has distinguished itself in the Dutch music education scene.

The school's goal is that aside from learning basic musical skills, special attention is given to developing improvisation skills and ear-training. We thereby apply structure in every student's musical abilities, achiving a high level of musicianship in result.

DJAM offers a complete musical education with theory as well as practical lessons, which are all geared toward one another. By offering courses on five levels, the program is suitable for beginners as well as advanced musicians. Through an entrance exam the level of the student is determined for every course.

The atmosphere at DJAM is often intense and personal. The number of students per class is manageable. DJAM can also be used to prepare for both the practical and theoretical parts of the Vakexamen Lichte Muziek or to prepare for admission to a conservatory.

DJAM is a meeting point for people who want to play music together. Our school, like every serious musician, is in a constant state of development.
profile_positions.title: Saxophone, clarinet & flute teacher

profile_positions.description:
General affairs, acquisition, marketing, promotion, teaching, coaching, working out student curricula.
Workshops: Music of Sonny Rollins (Utrecht, 2011), Groove Y'All (Rotterdam, 2012), Monk's Mind (Utrecht, 2012), Un Deux Trois Groovez (FR, 2014), Soul on Top (Buitenkunst, 2015), Snarky Puppy (Utrecht, 2016), Eddie Harris (2016), Jazz a Paris (2016), Snarky Puppy 2.0 (2016).
Year round ensembles: Small Bigband On the Roll, Dr. Loevenhout & Consorten, Amsterdam Improvisors Workshop.
profile_positions.title: Director

profile_positions.description: Music workshops Soul on Top (2015), Eddie Harris (2016), Prince (2017), Skunk Funk / Brecker Brothers (2018), Prince Part 2 (2019), Snarky Puppy (2020) are part of the workshop in the arts program of Stichting Buitenkunst (www.buitenkunst.nl).
profile_positions.title: workshop teacher

profile_positions.description: You can also contact saxophone and clarinet lessons Music Center LogBlock. The lessons are given by Iman Spaargaren. Iman: ‘My heart lies both in making music myself and in ensuring that people are connected to each other through listening to and playing music'.
